name: ember-bear

procedures: T1027.001::[Ember Bear] has added extra spaces between JavaScript code characters to increase the overall file size.
T1027.002::[Ember Bear] has packed malware to help avoid detection.
T1027.010::[Ember Bear] has obfuscated malicious scripts to help avoid detection.
T1027::[Ember Bear] has obfuscated malware to help avoid detection.
T1059.001::[Ember Bear] has used PowerShell to download and execute malicious code.
T1059.003::[Ember Bear] had used `cmd.exe` and Windows Script Host (wscript) to execute malicious code.
T1059.007::[Ember Bear] has used JavaScript to execute malicious code on a victim's machine.
T1102::[Ember Bear] has used Discord's content delivery network (CDN) to deliver malware and malicious scripts to a compromised host.
T1105::[Ember Bear] has used tools to download malicious code.
T1112::[Ember Bear] has used an open source batch script to modify Windows Defender registry keys.
T1203::[Ember Bear] has exploited Microsoft Office vulnerability CVE-2017-11882.
T1204.001::[Ember Bear] has attempted to lure users to click on a malicious link within a spearphishing email.
T1204.002::[Ember Bear] has attempted to lure victims into executing malicious files.
T1218.002::[Ember Bear] has used control panel files (CPL), delivered via e-mail, for execution.
T1553.002::[Ember Bear] has used stolen certificates from Electrum Technologies GmbH to sign payloads.
T1562.001::[Ember Bear] has executed a batch script designed to disable Windows Defender on a compromised host.
T1566.001::[Ember Bear] has sent spearphishing emails containing malicious attachments in the form of PDFs, Word documents, JavaScript files, and Control Panel File (CPL) executables.
T1566.002::[Ember Bear] has sent spearphishing emails containing malicious links.
T1588.002::[Ember Bear] has obtained and used open source scripts from GitHub.
T1588.003::[Ember Bear] has stolen legitimate certificates to sign malicious payloads.

description: [Ember Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1003) is a suspected Russian state-sponsored cyber espionage group that has been active since at least March 2021. [Ember Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1003) has primarily focused their operations against Ukraine and Georgia, but has also targeted Western European and North American foreign ministries, pharmaceutical companies, and financial sector organizations. Security researchers assess [Ember Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1003) likely conducted the [WhisperGate](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0689) destructive wiper attacks against Ukraine in early 2022.(Citation: CrowdStrike Ember Bear Profile March 2022)(Citation: Mandiant UNC2589 March 2022)(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )
